title: shopify_browse_messages
humanInputs: please handle after-sales work for this e-commerce site.

items: you will retrieve new unread e-commerce store related system or customers emails from gmail inbox for the past 3 days , and put them in a structured list of json dict data format: [{"title": "string", "from":"string", "datetime": "string", "attachments": ["string"], "contents": "string", "title_clickable": {"name": "string", "type": ""}, "platform email": "boolean", "needs_response": "boolean", "needs_human_in_loop": "boolean", "delayed_response": "boolean", "actions_needed": ["string"], "order_reference": "string"}
for email that can be immediately reponded, respond them.
for emails that need either human intervention, flag them and skip over for now.
for emails that need additional information as results of other tasks (such as order fullfill task), flag and come back later.

when working on gmail inboxes, make sure to use related tools to read unread emails' title ONLY.  From the title, 
1a) please classify the mail into two groups: 'e-commerce store related' or 'not e-commerce store related'. 
1b) for 'e-commerce store related' emails, further classify them into two groups: 'store platform sent' or 'customer sent'
1b1) for 'store platform sent' emails, further classify them into the following categories: 'advertising'/'warning'/'notification'/'other'
1b2) for 'customer sent' emails, further classify them into the following categories:
'question about product/services'/'quality complain'/'request for cancel'/'request for replacement or refund'/'report non-reception'/'request for return'/'compliment'/'request donation'/'other'

The following classified gmails do NOT need reponse: 'store platform sent'>'advertising',    all other type of 'store platform sent' and 'customer sent' emails might or might not need reponse depends on contents.
you must iterate through all e-commerce store related emails regardless whether you can answer all immediately.
For email you couldn't respond immediately, mark it unread aftewards so that it can be handle again in the next iteration of try.

You should always produce a json summery for the work like so: { "n_email_read: integer, "n_platform_emails": integer, "n_performance_warnings": integer, "n_customer_emails": integer, "n_emails_need_supervisor_intervention": integer, "n_email_responded": integer}
With a customer first ethos, our email response should always be polite and friendly, regardless how frustrated or angry customers might sound.
